SEARCH
Package com.example.eventlotterysystemapplication.Model

Class ImageStorage

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventlotterysystemapplication.Model.ImageStorage
public class ImageStorage extends Object
An singleton instance of this class represents a image storage bucket (currently on Firebase)

    • uploadEventPoster

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<android.net.Uri> uploadEventPoster(String eventId, File eventPosterFile, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener<android.net.Uri> imageUrlListener) throws OutOfMemoryError, IllegalArgumentException
      Uploads or replaces an event poster image (.png, .jpg, .jpeg, .gif, .svg, .webp) into Firebase Storage
      Parameters:
      eventId - The event ID (e.g. a png file will be stored as {eventId}.png)
      eventPosterFile - The local image file of the file
      imageUrlListener - An OnCompleteListener that obtains the download url link of the image (to be stored in Event object)
      Returns:
      An asynchronous task of Uri (this is ONLY used for testing purposes as the listeners did not work); please use the listeners when using this function on the main Android thread
      Throws:
      OutOfMemoryError
      IllegalArgumentException

    • deleteEventPoster

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteEventPoster(String posterDownloadUrl, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener<Void> listener)
      (PREFERRED WAY) Given a poster image download url that is stored on the event object, delete that poster image on the storage bucket
      Parameters:
      posterDownloadUrl - The poster download url (formatted like https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/cmput301-gamblers.firebasestorage.app/o/...jpg?alt=media&token=...)
      listener - A void OnCompleteListener that will be called upon delete task completion
      Returns:
      An asynchronous void task used ONLY for integration testing purposes. Please do not use the return result to access the task, use the OnCompleteListener instead :)

    • deleteEventPoster

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteEventPoster(com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener<Void> listener, String eventId)
      Deprecated.
      Images can now be any file extension other than .jpg
      Given an eventId, delete the associated event poster stored on the storage bucket This function assumes that the eventId poster is stored as an .jpg file which may lead to errors. Therefore, use the posterDownloadUrl deleteEventPoster function if possible.
      Parameters:
      listener - A void OnCompleteListener that will be called upon delete task completion
      eventId - The eventId of the event image poster (may or may not have an associated image so beware)
      Returns:
      An asynchronous void task used ONLY for integration testing purposes. Please do not use the return result to access the task, use the OnCompleteListener instead :)

    • fetchAllPosterImageUrls

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<com.google.firebase.storage.ListResult> fetchAllPosterImageUrls(com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener<List<String>> listener)
      One caveat is that all the images will be stored in memory so hopefully we don't have that many posters
      Parameters:
      listener - A OnCompleteListener that will be called upon fetch task completion, the task object will contain the list of download urls for all posters
      Returns:
      An asynchronous ListResult task used ONLY for integration testing purposes. Please do not use the return result to access the task, use the OnCompleteListener instead :)

    • fetchAllPosterImageUrlsByUserId

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Map<String,List<String>>> fetchAllPosterImageUrlsByUserId(com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener<Map<String,List<String>>> listener)
      Fetch all the poster images but group them by user ids. A hashmap will be used (key: user id string, value: list of all the poster image download urls created by the user)
      Parameters:
      listener - A OnCompleteListener that will be called upon fetch task completion, the task object will contain a hashmap of user id keys to list of poster download urls for the values
      Returns:
      An asynchronous hashmap task used ONLY for integration testing purposes. Please do not use the return result to access the task, use the OnCompleteListener instead :)
